parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From dikaios; to render just or innocent.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From kata and argeo; to be entirely idle, literally or figuratively.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From ek and pipto; to drop away; specially, be driven out of one's course; figuratively, to lose, become inefficient.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
